quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Characters and Words
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, actor, construction. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The English language has quite a variety of words for the babies of different animals. What is the proper word for a baby swan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sygnet

questions.question: In 1986, Sir Alex Ferguson became manager of this English Premier League soccer club, nicknamed The Red Devils.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Manchester United

questions.question: For which of these achievements did Sir Alexander Flemming win the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1945?

options.text: the discovery of the enzyme lysozyme
the introduction of the smallpox vaccine
developing a process which slows microbial growth in foods

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the discovery of penicillin

questions.question: Which statement is not true about political philosopher and economist Alexander Hamilton.

options.text: He served in the American Revolutionary War.
He was United States Secretary of the Treasury under Abraham Lincoln.
He was one of the Founding Fathers.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was United States Secretary of the Treasury under Abraham Lincoln.

questions.question: Alexander Graham Bell, known as the inventor of the telephone, is also credited with the invention of this device, which was first used after the assassination of President James Garfield.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: metal detector

questions.question: Which collective noun denotes a group of storks?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a mustering

questions.question: This is an uncommon English word deriving from the Yiddish word for to drag and means to move something from one place to another with difficulties.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Schlep

questions.question: Fashion designer Alexander McQueen, known as the hooligan of English fashion, succeeded John Galliano as head designer at this French fashion house.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Givenchy

questions.question: In the context of construction, how long is a 2d nail?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1 inch

questions.question: What author is not correctly matched with the literary work he created?

options.text: Alan Alexander Milne - The Wonderful Wizard of Oz
Alexander Pope - The Rape of the Lock
Alexandre Dumas, père - The Count of Monte Cristo

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alan Alexander Milne - The Wonderful Wizard of Oz

questions.question: Baseball player Alexander Rodriguez, who became the youngest player ever to hit 500 home runs, started his professional career with this team.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Seattle Mariners

questions.question: Which of these characters created by French writer Alexandre Dumas is not correctly matched with the novel?

options.text: Gérard de Villefort - Twenty Years After
Milady de Winter - The Three Musketeers

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gérard de Villefort - Twenty Years After

questions.question: What famous Greek philosopher tutored Alexander the Great and stimulated his interest in science, medicine, philosophy and literature?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aristotle

questions.question: Which of these characters portrayed by actor Alec Baldwin was not a real life person?

options.text: Jack Ryan (The Hunt for Red October)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Ryan (The Hunt for Red October)

questions.question: What is the next number in the following sequence, having in mind that it is related to positive integers: 1, 0.5, 0.333, 0.25, 0.2, 0.166, 0.142?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 0.125

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Pink and Sons
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, pink, cloak. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What do we call a horizontal beam used usually for support and walling over a window?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lintel

questions.question: What is the street in New York City, famous for jewels and jewelry?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 47th street

questions.question: In what century was the word pink used for the first time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 17th century

questions.question: This President was accused of fathering a child in a cloak room of the White House.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harding

questions.question: When is the expression seeing pink elephants most often used?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: when people are drunk

questions.question: Which statement below, concerning even numbers, is true?

options.text: There are no even irrational numbers
There are no even cardinal numbers
There are no even prime numbers
There are no even perfect numbers

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: There are no even irrational numbers

questions.question: In the world of design and construction, what is Zodiaq?

options.text: A material for improving safety glass

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A material used for countertops

questions.question: Pink is a line of lingerie by Victorias Secret.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of these words means someone who believes the self is the most important thing ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Egoist

questions.question: Is the Pink Cadillac the trademark of Mary Kay beauty products?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: His brother was boxing heavyweight champ. He fought Tyson for the heavyweight title, but lost in an early round KO.  Who was he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michal Spinks

questions.question: This composer hired cliquers to boo his sons early works at their premier. Eventually, the popularity of his sons works overcame the insults of the father and his stooges. Name the father.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johann  Strauss

questions.question: Pink is the color of what ribbon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Breast Cancer Awareness ribbon

questions.question: Who did Time magazine name as “Person of the Year for 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Internet user

questions.question: Pink is a song by Guns N Roses.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Singer and Freecreditreport.com
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, stars, loan. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In Thailand, pink is associated with what day of the week?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tuesday

questions.question: Which two kinds of vehicles does the singer want to buy in the new car freecreditreport.com commercial?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a convertible and an SUV

questions.question: What color are the tights the lead singer is wearing in one of the freecreditreport.com commercials?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: green

questions.question: In the pirate freecreditreport.com ad, who stole the mans identity?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a hacker

questions.question: Finish this line from the pirate freecreditreport.com commercial: They say a man should always. . .

options.text: bless corn on the cob he wants
make a mess in the mob he haunts
dress for the job he wins
dress for the job he wants

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: dress for the job he wants

questions.question: Where do the lead singer and his wife live in one of the freecreditreport.com ads?

options.text: in the back of a fish n chips restaurant
in the basement of her mom and dads

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: in the basement of her mom and dads

questions.question: In the new car freecreditreport.com commercial, instead of looking fly and rolling phat, what happens when the boys drive their new car?

options.text: legs are sticking to the vinyl and the posses getting laughed at
Megs slicker than vinyl and my boss is getting laid back
pegs are stickin to a rhino and the boss is getting flat
legs are feelin like a rhino and the mosss betting last

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: legs are sticking to the vinyl and the posses getting laughed at

questions.question: Who was the first player selected by the Dallas Cowboys in the football draft?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Lilly

questions.question: Which of the following is the Latin word for pink?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roseus

questions.question: In one of the freecreditreport.com commercials, the singers relegated to riding a bicycle for transportation. How is the singer rolling in this ad?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: eco-friendly

questions.question: Which city has a Pink Line rail service?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago

questions.question: What three things do rock stars get to have according to a freecreditreport.com commercial?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: champagne, caviar, exotic cars

questions.question: Why couldnt the couple get a loan for a respectable home in one of the freecreditreport.com commercials?

options.text: She defaulted on some old credit card.
Some punk opened a credit card in her name.
He had a poor credit score.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She defaulted on some old credit card.

questions.question: What fashion designer popularized the color known as shocking pink?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elsa Schiaparelli

questions.question: In one of the freecreditreport.com commercials the boys are at the Renaissance Faire. How was the lead singer feeling at the beginning of the song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: depressed

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Language and Song
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, computers, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: He is a very popular American entertainer.  His wife, Compton Maalak, operates a full service non-profit salon giving free services to women trying to get off welfare and going into jobs.  He was in Beverly Hills Cop II” and voiced a role in Madagascar. Who is he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chris Rock

questions.question: Sancho Panza was the squire to and the best friend of Don Quixote. What does panza” mean in Spanish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Belly

questions.question: This famous song was written about a love letter to a girl named Wendy. The writer loves her, but just has to get out of town.  What is the name of the song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Born to Run

questions.question: He was the first Major League Baseball manager to win a World Series in both the National and American Leagues.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sparky Anderson

questions.question: Which of these countries does not border Georgia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Belarus

questions.question: It is generally accepted that paper money was invented in this nation.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: China

questions.question: Finnish, the language spoken by over 94 % of the people of Finland is most closely related to this language.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Estonian

questions.question: This person was recognized as the first billionaire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John D. Rockefeller

questions.question: Which is the author of The Scarlatti Inheritance, The Matarese Cycle, The Osterman Weekend, and The Scorpio Illusion.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Ludlum

questions.question: Almost everyone knows of Hank Aaron, Babe Ruth, Sandy Koufax, Bob Gibson, and Ichiro Suzuki but who was Bill Klem?

options.text: The man who replaced Lou Gehrig at first base for the Yankees.
The man who sold Babe Ruth to the Yankees

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Father of Modern Umpires

questions.question: Windows runs most computers. When the first version of the Windows Operating System released?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1981

questions.question: The 1927 movie Wings was the first winner of the Best Picture Oscar. Which of these actors was in it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gary Cooper

questions.question: Who is the creator of the first steam locomotive?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Trevithick

questions.question: What is the common between the years 1914, 1918, 1935, 1940, 1941, 1942 and 1943?

options.text: In these years, there was no Dali Lama.
In these years no received a Nobel Prize in Literature.
In these years there, Republican and Democratic Parties each had exactly 50 votes in the US Senate.
In those years an extra 1second was added to the year to make the solar year correct.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In these years no received a Nobel Prize in Literature.

questions.question: The first motion picture that was longer than one hour was made in this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Australia

questions.question: The first shoes made on separate lasts for left and right shoes were made in this city.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: People and Columbus
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, mean, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: On his third voyage to the Western hemisphere, Columbus wrote that he found where the Garden of Eden was. What do we now call the area which Columbus felt was the Garden of Eden ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Venezuela

questions.question: The S.O.S. on SOS cleaning pads stands for Save Our Saucepans.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Under  which US President were the Barbary Wars fought?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Jefferson

questions.question: Who was the first female Attorney General of the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Janet Reno

questions.question: What does a la crecy  mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Served with carrots

questions.question: How big is a firkin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 9 gallons

questions.question: During World War II, Paul Newman applied to become a fighter  pilot. Why was he rejected?

options.text: He did not pass the written test.
He had an inner ear problem that affected his sense of balance.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was color blind.

questions.question: Which two countries are connected  by the Simplon Pass?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Switzerland and Italy

questions.question: The Barbary Wars were  fought between the USA and pirates from this part of the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Mediterranean Coast of Africa

questions.question: What is the approximate distance between the Moon and the Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 384,000 kilometers

questions.question: The exchange of letters between these two people was published in 1933 under the title Why War?.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Einstein and Freud

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronald Reagan

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1

questions.question: The first bridge in what would become the USA was built in this state.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Massachusetts

questions.question: Traditionally the people of the country of Georgia believe that they are descendants of this Biblical personality.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Japheth
